title: PPK-PCK Integrated Instructional Design for Mathematics Teacher Education: Focus on Computation, Formulas, Problem-Solving, Proof, Graph, and Statistical Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate coursework in relevant fields or equivalent experience (mathematics content knowledge—calculations, formulas, proofs, graphs, statistics—general pedagogical knowledge, and digital tool proficiency)
context.additional_context: An online teacher education program for math pre-service teachers, designed to integrate PPK (Pedagogical Content Knowledge) and PCK (Pedagogical Content Knowledge). Operates through digital tools (whiteboard collaboration, real-time polls) and formative assessments (problem-solving analysis, concept checklists, graph interpretation).

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three strategies for simultaneously applying PPK and PCK in real math class scenarios (e.g., error analysis in equation solving, graph interpretation activity design, probability concept visualization, geometric proof process reconstruction).

Learners can design instructional plans for teaching math content (e.g., geometric proofs, statistical analysis, function graphs, probability distributions) that consider learners' cognitive developmental stages.

Using GeoGebra or Desmos, learners can develop PPK-PCK integrated instructional materials (one interactive equation-solving module, one dynamic graph generator, one statistical simulation tool) and submit resources meeting at least two of three effectiveness feedback criteria from peer reviews and expert evaluations.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
